title: Easy Overnight Oats (That Taste Like Dessert for Breakfast)

Directions
In a 1-quart container or medium bowl, whisk together oat milk, maple syrup, vanilla paste or extract (if using), and salt until well combined.
Serious Eats / Amanda Suarez
Add oats and chia seeds and stir to combine.
Serious Eats / Amanda Suarez
Refrigerate until oats have softened and thickened, at least 8 hours and up to 24 hours. Sweeten with additional maple syrup as needed and serve with fresh fruit, if desired.
Serious Eats / Amanda Suarez
Notes
Your choice of dairy or dairy-free milk can be substituted for oat milk. I tested this with regular sweetened oat milk, but if you’d like to cut down on the sugar, you can use unsweetened oat milk. To make gluten-free overnight oats, use gluten-free rolled oats.
Make-Ahead and Storage
The recipe can easily be doubled. Overnight oats can be refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 3 days.
